page.title: 05FARMING 1.GENERAL
page.content: The farms of the area are mostly family, mixed farms of between 75 and 200 acres and one undertaking that does contract work for other farmers. There are also some smallholdings of only a few acres which do not provide sufficient income to maintain a family, but are supplemental to some other work. There is a nursery with glasshouses which provides plants and vegetables to local customers. There is much concern in the area for the future of farming and therefore for the countryside as a whole. The economy is based on the family farm, but because of instability tourism is fast becoming a close second and a complementary boost as the extra rooms in the farmhouse can be used for bed and breakfast in the summer season.
